decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield early in the game. The deck also includes various ways to protect these creatures, such as Force of Will and Flusterstorm, as well as cards like Stock Up to help find the combo pieces quickly. The mana base is designed to support the combo, with City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb providing additional mana acceleration.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with key creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back into play for a powerful combo. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the opponent's actions. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Murktide Regent provide additional card advantage and threats on the battlefield. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently reanimating high-impact creatures and overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The deck focuses on quickly disrupting opponents' game plans while also applying pressure with various creatures. It utilizes cards like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Aether Vial ensures efficient creature deployment, while cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard allow for searching key pieces like equipment and utility creatures. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Solitude to deal with threats effectively. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while steadily building a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing Life from the Loam to recur lands and generate value. The deck aims to grind out the opponent by generating card advantage, managing the board with removal spells like Smallpox and Fatal Push, and disrupting key cards with Pithing Needle and Thoughtseize. Additionally, the deck can generate threats like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Barrowgoyf to close out the game. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor up important artifacts and lands to further its game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's board by constantly disrupting their plays with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will while also maintaining tempo with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also aims to pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. The inclusion of cards like Daze and Brainstorm allows for flexibility and adaptability in different situations. By combining disruption, removal, and aggressive threats, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a victory.

The deck utilizes a combination of control elements and the Loam mechanic to disrupt the opponent's resources and gradually grind out advantage. It focuses on recurring lands with Life from the Loam to fuel Smallpox and Wasteland, while also utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Eumidian Hatchery to generate value. The deck also includes graveyard recursion with Hogaak and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt opposing strategies. Overall, the key strategy revolves around resource denial, incremental advantage, and flexible card choices to adapt to different matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo win. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to outpace and overwhelm opponents with powerful creature threats while controlling the game with counterspells and hand disruption.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a strong emphasis on tempo and disruption. It utilizes low-cost threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly put pressure on the opponent, while also including disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to control the board. The deck also includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Murktide Regent to generate card advantage and maintain momentum. By combining efficient creatures with powerful spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of efficient spells and creatures to control the board and deal damage quickly. It relies on cheap counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats, while also utilizing cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to set up its draws. The deck includes powerful creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. Wasteland provides disruption to slow down opponents, making this UR Aggro deck a fast and versatile choice for Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small aggressive creatures while disrupting their strategy with cards like Suppression Field and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. This Aggro-Weenie White deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and deal significant damage to the opponent before they have a chance to respond effectively. The inclusion of cards like Swords to Plowshares and Esper Sentinel helps to control the opponent's creatures and card advantage, while cards like Wasteland and Karakas disrupt their mana base.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan using Chalice of the Void and Wasteland. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith, the deck aims to play its high impact threats early in the game and dominate the battlefield. The inclusion of cards like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer provide disruption and pressure, while cards like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple allow for efficient casting of Eldrazi creatures. Overall, this deck aims to be fast and aggressive, putting pressure on the opponent from the start.

This deck focuses on using the Cephalid Breakfast combo to quickly mill cards from the library and win the game by either casting Thassa's Oracle or using Dread Return to bring back a creature like Nadu, Winged Wisdom. The deck includes several tutors and cantrips to find pieces of the combo quickly, as well as disruption in the form of Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. With the right pieces in hand, this deck can win the game in just a few turns.

The deck aims to quickly assemble a lethal combo using all spell cards and win the game without ever needing to cast a single creature. By using cards such as Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual to quickly ramp up mana, the player can quickly mill their entire library with cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer. Thassa's Oracle is then used to win the game by having no cards left in the library. The deck includes various protection spells like Pact of Negation and Cabal Therapy to ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It utilizes various control cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also having ways to protect its own creatures with cards like Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to reanimate big threats early in the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures, utilizing a combination of combo and reanimation strategies to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and using cards like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command to disrupt opponents' strategies. With cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, the deck aims to apply early pressure and overwhelm opponents before they can stabilize. Additionally, the use of lands like Cavern of Souls and Eye of Ugin ensures that Eldrazi creatures can be efficiently cast and protected from counterspells. The inclusion of mana acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith also allows for explosive starts and quick deployment of threats.

The main objective of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Witherbloom Command, the deck is able to handle a variety of threats while staying ahead in cards with cards like Brainstorm and Cling to Dust. Additionally, the deck has a strong late-game plan with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Murktide Regent to close out the game. The mana base includes several dual lands and powerful utility lands like Wasteland to support the deck's strategies.
